intro: Axinaea confusa, commonly known as the pink axinaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Axinaea confusa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
